alert.note: Alert for Cass (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 5:43AM CDT until August 02 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Cass County in southwestern Iowa... * Until 1130 AM CDT. * At 543 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen so far this morning with additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches possible in the warned area over the next few hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Atlantic, Lewis, Massena, Cumberland, Marne, Wiota, Atlantic Municipal Airport and Cold Springs State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
